skills.name: Java
skills.description: I will call myself primary Java developer. I have the most experience there and use language on a daily basis. But I also knew JavaScript fairly well and have developed nice looking applications without using any framework. Kotlin is similar to Java and I have written two Android apps using it. In C/C++ I have started programming, but have not done anything complex in it, but if there would be a need I could very quick refresh my skills. Recently, I have also played with Assembly to have a better grasp of what is going on on the lowest level.

skills.name: SQL
skills.description: I am familiar with SQL as most applications, in which I needed to store persistent data are using it. I used MySQL on server-side and SQLite on Android. When it comes to version control system, choice is rather obvious now. I have used Git extensively both at my work and personal projects. If we talk about build systems I prefer and have the most experience using Maven. I use it by default. Gradle have to be used, if you want to create Android apps. Having done that, I am also familiar with this system.
